metadata.Title: CVE-2023-3603 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: A missing allocation check in sftp server processing read requests may cause a NULL dereference on low-memory conditions. The malicious client can request up to 4GB SFTP reads, causing allocation of up to 4GB buffers, which was not being checked for failure. This will likely crash the authenticated user's sftp server connection (if implemented as forking as recommended). For thread-based servers, this might also cause DoS for legitimate users. Given this code is not in any released versions, no security releases have been issued.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> code is not present in any released version

criterions.comment: libssh: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
